p: Stricter measures taken by HCWs in the hospital, like using added personal protective equipment (gloves, masks, gowns) and more environmental sanitation, may have decreased the number of infected HCWs ( Figure 5a). Additionally, it would have been supportive if restricting mobile healthcare workers (HCWm), as they faced relatively higher transmission rates after about 13 days since the beginning of the epidemic or the admission of the index case ( Figure 5b).
